bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 28 (Thursday, February 16, 2017)][Pages H1304-H1305]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. JENKINS of Kansas:H.R. 1155.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8:The Congress shall have Power To lay and collect Taxes,Duties, Imposts and Excises, to pay the Debts and provide forthe common[[Page H1305]]Defense and general Welfare of the United States; but allDuties, Imposts and Excises shall be uniform throughout theUnited States.Article I, Section 9:No Money shall be drawn from the Treasury, but inConsequence of Appropriations made by Law.

item.latestTitle: Improving Access to Cardiac and Pulmonary Rehabilitation Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

Referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to allow physician assistants, nurse practitioners, and clinical nurse specialists to supervise cardiac, intensive cardiac, and pulmonary rehabilitation programs.
item.name: Introduced in House

To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to allow physician assistants, nurse practitioners, and clinical nurse specialists to supervise cardiac, intensive cardiac, and pulmonary rehabilitation programs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
